newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico may declare rail auction null and void.
newsitem.headline: Mexico may declare rail auction null and void.

text.p: Mexico's Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) has proposed declaring the auction for the Chihuahua-Pacific railroad line null and void, assistant secretary of transport Aaron Dickter said on Wednesday.

The news followed a single bid for the rail line by Mexican mining firm Grupo Mexico of 201.79 million pesos earlier in the day, well below the 376 million estimated by officials as the value of the line.
The auction was for a 50-year concession to run the railway.
"By not meeting the minimum conditions, we have proposed declaring the auction of the Chihuahua-Pacific rail null and void," he told a news conference.
Dickter said the ministry would begin accepting bids for the Northwest line, the second part of the country's railroad privatization, on November 29.
He said the government may include the Chihuahua-Pacific line in the concession for the Northwest line.
"We have to decide whether to hold another auction for the Chihuahua-Pacific rail line, or include it in the Northwest line," Dickter said.
Grupo Mexico had said it would be willing to invest 120 million pesos in the Chihuahua-Pacific railroad if it won the concession.
